questions.question: 1. Fatigue curves are popularly known as ____ curves.

explanations.d: Fatigue curves are popularly known as S-N curves. S stands for stress and N stands for the number of cycles. The number of cycles is taken as log N.

questions.question: 2. What term is used for the maximum stress at which materials fail for a specified number of cycles?

explanations.a: The maximum stress at which materials fail for a specified number of cycles is fatigue strength. Many materials exhibit a limiting stress value. Below this, it can be operated for an indefinitely large number of cycles.
explanations.b: Fatigue life is a mechanical term that relates to how long an object or material will last before completely failing because of concentrated stresses.
explanations.c: Ultimate tensile strength (UTS) is the maximum stress that a material can withstand while being stretched or pulled before breaking.
explanations.d: The endurance limit (Se) of a material is defined as the stress below which a material can endure an infinite number of repeated load cycles without exhibiting failure.

questions.question: 3. What range of cycles is chosen for endurance limit?

explanations.c: In nonferrous materials, non-effective fatigue limit is shown. The stress corresponding to 10<sup>7</sup> – 10<sup>8</sup> cycles is taken as endurance limit.
